intro: Tithymalus tranzschelii, commonly known as the Transhimalayan tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Tithymalus tranzschelii is adapted to cold climates and has a slow growth rate, making it a rare and specialized species.
